intro: Licaria deltoidea, commonly known as the delta leaf licaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its deltoid-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
